title.narrative: OPT 1. 5. PARENTS AND CAREGIVERS APPLY KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO RESPOND TO THE NEE

description.narrative: 1.5. Parents, caregivers and community representatives have knowledge and skills to care for, respond and manage the needs of children under five years in the municipalities receiving UNICEF support,which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children between 0 and 5 have access to Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) services to guarantee that they survive and thrive, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Social and behavioural change communication for ECD

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/401 OCM 1. EVERY CHILD SURVIVES AND THRIVES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.5. Parents, caregivers and community representatives have knowledge and skills to care for, respond and manage the needs of children under five years in the municipalities receiving UNICEF support

description.narrative:
Based on the results of the KAP study conducted in 2018, UNICEF developed two Communication for Development (C4D) strategies for IECD: one in El Alto (Mercedes area - District 8), and another in Independencia.
A Communication Committee was formed in El Alto, and an Inter-institutional Platform in Independencia, to support the implementation of both C4D strategies. Behaviour changes will be promoted in the areas of responsible fatherhood, affectionate and nurturing care, non-violent discipline and how to create early learning environments. The play and communication capacities of 220 families were strengthened through implementation of the Care for child development approach (CCD). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Generation and use of social, behavioural and communication data and evidence meets quality standards for informing and monitoring C4D strategies in Country Programme priorities
% of boys and girls under 5 years of age whose father and mother has carried out four or more activities to promote IECD in the last three days in intervention areas (El Alto e Independencia)

target.value: 2022:10% increase over the baseline in El Alto (Mercedes area) and 10% increase over the base line in Independencia

title.narrative: % fathers, mothers and caregivers who are knowledgeable regarding integrated care, education and protection of girls and boys from 0 to 5 years of age in intervention areas (El Alto, Independencia)

target.value: 2022:20% increase over the baseline in El Alto (Mercedes Area)
